posts.author: TyrTemplar
posts.content:
Looking good, Empyre. KD, some more HPs maybe (though, with the epic traps, take 20 when not in combat, heh, not really an issue PvM/E). Might also want to full train up UMD (unlike bard, rogue has no auto access to arcane items, etc. so needs to full train, as that's good to have for a rogue as well, though 25+ is a good number most places, most true, depending on where one is playing and what's available, etc. so that's cool). Otherwise, it's really nice for a str-based stalker.

As to cap for sneak, depends on what you're up against, Valkos, and where you are playing. If it's weaklings, then don't need much. All fun aside, if up against high DR enemies (high magic especially, where everything and their minions tend to have DR and elemental resistances, etc. up the wazoo) you need damage to breach and next say to dual-wield Bane Ranger (and Grt.Smiting Paladin of course!) sneak is one of the more effective ways to go when it comes to breaching, assuming you're not up against Sneak/Crit immunes (ie. undeads) that is. In low magic, don't need so much by contrast (especially with your traps, with traps being an excellent way to not only soften up the opposition/hordes but also quick-kill if laid right big foes, which traps come in all flavours (damage types) so as to be a great thing to have regardless, all magic levels and including high magic: not only verstatile, but deadly/lethal effective as well).

Remember, though, when it comes to sneak (and breaching DR), when striking out of the benefits of stealth, you'll want to punch hard so as to make that surprise strike count for all it's worth right up front--and when dual wield, that's 6 apr (7 apr hasted of course, via UMD or perma-haste item), all of those shots sneak charged, heh, when have lots of it your foe doesn't tend to strike back, provided they don't detect you and/or aren't sneak/crit immune. In terms of delivering that damage, if PvM (mod), can spam HiPs so have fun, with KD being a good "old school" method of generating sneak opps, most true, too. However, in many places there's a cool down on HiPs among other things (so can't spam it), and if so you'll enjoy having all that sneak damage from the get go, being true of high magic settings, too (on account of the DR, etc).

As to pre-epic spread, ordinarily I am one to argue for AB and more of it (no such thing as too much AB when it comes to melee and other things that need to hit in order to deliver damage, just isn't) but in this case since your soon to be Devastator enjoys not only epic traps but also HiPs, crippling strike (which lowers enemy strength thus their AB etc., raising your defense etc. in turn) is rather nice thing to have, no? That said, since you have dev.crit, there are some who would argue that crippling with Dev.Crit is over-kill, preferring an extra AB instead (and if you're going to melee proper, i.e., a cool-down on the HiPs so as to be unable (can't) or don't want to spam it, preferring and/or forced to straight-up duel instead, then you'll likely prefer more hard AB in turn (and if so, then more HPs would be good; 400 being the minimum for melee, always was), but with HiPs and the epic traps, you have some wiggle room here, depending on what you prefer/want and where you intend on playing your new toon.

Your wish is the ECB's pleasure, yes? (Looking good, Empyre. I think so, too

Cheers
